channel.title: Knights on Wires
channel.description: In knights on Wires Peter, Johan and Robin (and other visiting friends) talk about what they're busy with. Tune in to hear about the ins and outs of JavaScript, Java, Ruby, Postgres, AWS, Azure and maybe even the occasional CNC machine!
channel.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
channel.itunes:summary: In knights on Wires Peter, Johan and Robin (and other visiting friends) talk about what they're busy with. Tune in to hear about the ins and outs of JavaScript, Java, Ruby, Postgres, AWS, Azure and maybe even the occasional CNC machine!

item.title: 000: Knights on Wires Pod Trailer
item.author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:subtitle: New podcast trailer!
item.description:
New podcast trailer!
Welcome!
Hi there!
My name is Peter van der Meulen and together with Johan Deckmar and Robin Rosenberg we’re starting a podcast.
We’re all software developers at Knightec in Sweden and in the coming few months we’d love you take you with us on our coding adventures.
Every other week we’ll try to tune in to talk about what we’ve been busy with and what challenges we faced or are facing.
We are recording our first session in the next few days, so stay tuned for Episode 1!
Look for “Knighs on wires” wherever you listen to podcasts!
Links
Knights on wires website
item.content:encoded:
New podcast trailer!

Welcome!

Hi there!

My name is Peter van der Meulen and together with Johan Deckmar and Robin Rosenberg we’re starting a podcast.

Every other week we’ll try to tune in to talk about what we’ve been busy with and what challenges we faced or are facing.

We are recording our first session in the next few days, so stay tuned for Episode 1!

Look for “Knighs on wires” wherever you listen to podcasts!

item.title: 001: Lakes and buns
item.author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:subtitle: Our first episode! Johan, Robin and Peter talk about bun.sh, high frequency data and data lakes
item.description:

item.title: 002: Snapshot Text Editors
item.author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from Louvre (one of Knightec’s meeting rooms in Sundvall, Sweden) and the Stockholm office; Peter, Johan and Robin discuss AI for business, CDK snapshots and the landscape of WYSIWYG Text editors.
item.description:
Live from Louvre (one of Knightec’s meeting rooms in Sundvall, Sweden) and the Stockholm office; Peter, Johan and Robin discuss AI for business, CDK snapshots and the landscape of WYSIWYG Text editors.
Links
Knights on wires website ChatGPT Cloud Formation Templates Syrupy snapshots Multi modal Large language models on Azure Digital self-management Atomic Design Storybook component kits Editor.js Trix editor Slate Editor Draft.jS CKEditor5 TinyMCE Contenteditable API Count meta-argument in Terraform
Special thanks
Theme music remixed from tunes by Alexi Action and TuesdayNight. Mixing, editing and album art by Peter vd Meulen
This podcast is produced by folks working at Knightec, your strategic partner in product and service development. Learn more and contact us at knightec.se/
Questions or suggestions for out podcast? contact us!

item.title: 003: Onboarding, Pitfalls & Rust
item.author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:subtitle: In this week’s episode Johan dives into the pitfalls of large language models, Robin goes over his ways of onboarding people onto a team and Peter talks about his journey into the world of desktop applications with Tauri & Svelte.
item.description:
In this week’s episode Johan dives into the pitfalls of large language models, Robin goes over his ways of onboarding people onto a team and Peter talks about his journey into the world of desktop applications with Tauri & Svelte.
The audio quality of this episode is not the best, we’re doing our best to make sure we all got our microphones setup correctly next time!
Links
Knights on wires website ChatGPT Mistral WormGPT VSCode Neovim Tauri SvelteKit SvelteKit in Tauri
Special thanks
Theme music remixed from tunes by Alexi Action and TuesdayNight. Mixing, editing and album art by Peter vd Meulen
This podcast is produced by folks working at Knightec, your strategic partner in product and service development. Learn more and contact us at knightec.se/
Questions or suggestions for out podcast? contact us!
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s episode Johan dives into the pitfalls of large language models, Robin goes over his ways of onboarding people onto a team and Peter talks about his journey into the world of desktop applications with Tauri & Svelte.

The audio quality of this episode is not the best, we’re doing our best to make sure we all got our microphones setup correctly next time!

Links

  • ChatGPT

item.title: 004: GPT says "No"
item.author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:author: Knightec Dewire
item.itunes:subtitle: Back from being away!
item.description:
Back from being away!
In this weeks episode Peter dives into Tailwind on top of NextJS, Robin looks at Grafana and Johan’s been tuning in to new updates coming to OpenAI.
Got nothing to do this weekend? Hang with us, we’re going to Hacknext
Links
Knights on wires website NextJS Tailwind CSS I18Next Period Table if Visualization methods Grafana Prometheus OpenAI DevDay OpenAI GPTs Hacknext
Special thanks
Theme music remixed from tunes by Alexi Action and TuesdayNight. Mixing, editing and album art by Peter vd Meulen
This podcast is produced by folks working at Knightec, your strategic partner in product and service development. Learn more and contact us at knightec.se/
Questions or suggestions for out podcast? contact us!
